text: Hi Garisingh,   why was the concept of  NVP   created and what is the reason to removed.  Thanks   :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi <@U1W210996>! Nope, still unresolved.
I have the same issue now :disappointed:

"It is possible that you ran `docker-compose up`, then stopped the containers, slightly modified the yaml (perhaps changing the peer config) and then ran `docker-compose up` again?" This is the comment from <@U0PB67X4K>. I did the same except changing the peer config file.
I think this is the main reason why we are getting this error.
I went another way. I have built membersrvc and peer from hyperledger/fabric source folder.
<@U2MBWGE06|mayankanup> has joined the channel
<@U1W210996> Are you using the docker compose?
no. I start them with ‘membersrvc' and ‘peer node start’ commands from fabric directory
<@U2LHDBZM0> Looks like it is working again. I just removed /var/hyperledger/production one more time and restarted services
<@U2MCH9EEB|crazybit> has joined the channel
<@U1W210996>: Great :slightly_smiling_face:

On April 29th in Paris, between IEEE S&P and Eurocrypt, we are hosting IEEE Security & Privacy on Blockchain <http://prosecco.gforge.inria.fr/ieee-blockchain2016/> — I am chair of program committee. The deadline for submissions is December 14th.
i am new to fabric,any one can tell any quick way to build and run the fabric in local pc, btw, i am using ubuntu
Here is the info <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Network-setup/>
Is uses Host-VM-Docker model
*It uses

<@U2MCH9EEB>  - I highly advise using the Docker images rather than trying to build thing locally on the host.   You really want to get started with basic chaincode development initially - so <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/Chaincode-setup/> would be my recommended starting point as well
<@U1W210996> <@U0PB67X4K>  thanks
Guys, is it possible to start several nodes on a single machine?
yeah, using docker & scaling
whats the use case?
Actually I’d like to investigate how pbft works. As far as I understand it requires 4 nodes in the network
<@U2MD81NV7|robert.symes> has joined the channel
<@U1W210996> , look in directory hyperledger/fabric/bddtests for examples on how to run 4+ nodes with PBFT with docker-compose  ...
i've usually run with vagrant and docker-compose  ... if you want to run on actual OS or using VM, you'll  need to play around with addresses and port numbers
Thanks!
can any one briefly tell me what is the different between PBFT and POW/DPOS

<@U2MCH9EEB>, the guys working on fabric consensus use <#C0Z4NBUN6|fabric-consensus-dev>  ...  PBFT nodes exchange messages and depend on receiving from enough nodes to determine consensus , no proof like PoW  ... the seminal paper is `Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerance and Proactive Recovery` by Castro & Liskov

Can anybody say what does this message mean?
`Currently system chaincode does support security(noop,<http://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/bddtests/syschaincode/noop|github.com/hyperledger/fabric/bddtests/syschaincode/noop>)`?
<@U1W210996|zemtsov> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/zemtsov/F2MDV4R97/screen_shot_2016-10-10_at_16.54.08.png|Warning>
Very nice demo of the Gossip protocol has been placed on the <#C28M6TC90|playbacks> channel

Quick question about PBFT - doesn anyone know on what grounds the validating leader is changed? (i.e. is it every block, after a certain number of TXs etc.)

Following from this how is the new leader chosen?
validating peers make the election
and choose the new leader
what kicks off an election?
and how do they decide who to vote for?
<@U2ME96U3F|gatb27> has joined the channel

<@U0TH5GUQ6>  hey are you up for looking into getting Slack to treat Hyperledger as a registered non-profit? It'd be really useful to be able to see the chat history in all the channels. Might one of our industry partners be prepared to put some cash in? Here's the relevant page on Slack's website: <https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/204368833>

attachments.title: Slack for Nonprofits
attachments.text: The Slack for Nonprofits program offers eligible organizations a free upgrade to our Standard plan for teams of up to 250 members. We offer an 85% discount on the Standard plan to eligible teams ab...
attachments.fallback: Slack Help Center: Slack for Nonprofits

text: We already asked, they already said no, since we're a 501c6 (industrial consortium) and not a 501c3.
$200k was the quoted amount since we have so many individual users.
that's insane unless there truly are no alternatives.  plus, anything non-temporary should be done on mailing lists or in Jira anyways.
that is bonkers – thanks for getting back.
<@U2MF53WBF|krams> has joined the channel
<@U2MF3A4A0|abhishekbp> has joined the channel
<@U24JMTPRQ> another reason not to do that is that not everybody can use/access slack so we've decided not to fully depend on slack
we've discussed alternatives - there are quite a few - but not managed to converge on a particular solution so far

question yesterday I brought up 4 Validating peers and one none validating peer plus memberservc.   I was told I don't need NVP.  I took the address on NVP in my core,yaml       now it still looking for the NVP.  how do I tell him    to stop looking for it
what's the value of `peer.discovery.persist` ?
by value, you mean purpose?
no... I mean value
in the yaml
true or false
true by default
I think the solution to his problem is to delete the NVP from the persistor, if that is in use
that's what I'm trying to get to, Gari.
yeah - except it is stored in the DB
:disappointed:
oh? really?
yep
you're right
I know because I have face this issue  :disappointed:
I didn't, only remembered going through that code in the past... isn't there a way of taking down a VP 1-by-1 and deleting it from rocks DB?
is there even a CLI to rocksDB?
So basically if the persistor is enabled (and is, by default)- your DB is tattooed forever with all peers you've ever seen before. a blessing and a curse.
Therefore I must delete it. or accept the fact as it is.
I am also getting too many open files... and then abort
oh really?
that's interesting, can you please attach an output of `lsof` on the process? or is it already dead?

it's already dead

I rebuild the /var/hyperledger/production  on each of the peers running and the membersrvc  and now the problem of too many file open resolved.   Question I have now is membersrvc.  To get every reloaded I have to bring-up  a non-validating  "peer" on the membersrvc server.  and then copy everything on the /var/hyperLedger/production directory to each of the peer that runs the chaincode.   Is there a better way of doing this?  how do we deal with new enrollment?

<@U0TH5GUQ6> If you are looking for an alternative to Slack, you might check out Rocket Chat (<https://rocket.chat/>).  I encountered it on another project, and it seems functionally comparable to Slack.  It is open source though so not subject to the tiered Slack limitations.

attachments.title: Rocket.Chat
attachments.text: From group messages and video calls all the way to helpdesk killer features our goal is to become the number one cross-platform open source chat solution.

<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0Z41KY5V> I have a question, a chaincode deployed on vps. If a vp turn off, the chaincode on it turn off as follow, but if the vp turn on, the chaincode can turn on too?
<@U2MNG4SMA|hustdihu> has joined the channel
Chaincode is deploying onto all vps in the network. If one of vps goes offline, chaincode still lives in the blockchain.
<@U21PYLBH7> how’s ur deployment topology? If you deploy vp and chaincode together, then both will turn off after the shutdown. However, other peers will still provide the service normally.
<@U0Z41KY5V> I know both will shutdown, but if the vp power on, can  the chaincode startup automatically？Tks
That depends. Can u describe the deployment details?
I'm just curious. Because If the chaincode can’t be automatically startup after the vp, this vp is pointless for consensus
<@U0Z41KY5V>  is there some way  in net model chaincode container and vp container can run in different host?
certainly
and  where  can i get detail?
What is chaincode container?
see vm configurations in the core.yaml file
i get it  ,thanks
